title: Coconut Curry Chicken
ingredients:
1 pound boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces
    1 tablespoon vegetable oil
    1 onion, chopped
    2 cloves garlic, minced
    1 tablespoon curry powder
    1 teaspoon ground ginger
    1 (13.5 oz) can coconut milk
    1 cup chicken broth
    1 tablespoon soy sauce
    1 tablespoon brown sugar
    1 red bell pepper, chopped (optional)
    1 green bell pepper, chopped (optional)
    1 cup broccoli florets (optional)
    Chopped fresh cilantro (for garnish)
    Cooked rice (for serving)
introduction: A creamy and flavorful Thai-inspired dish.
instructions:
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
    Add the chicken and cook until browned on all sides.
    Remove chicken from the pan and set aside.
    Add the onion and garlic to the pan and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
    Stir in the curry powder and ginger, and cook for another minute.
    Pour in the coconut milk, chicken broth, soy sauce, and brown sugar.
    Bring to a simmer.
    Add the red bell pepper, green bell pepper, and broccoli (if using), and cook for 5-7 minutes, or until tender-crisp.
    Return the chicken to the pan and heat through.
    Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and serve over cooked rice.

title: One-Pan Lemon Garlic Salmon with Roasted Vegetables
ingredients:
2 salmon fillets (about 6 oz each)
    1 tablespoon olive oil
    1 lemon, sliced
    2 cloves garlic, minced
    1/2 teaspoon dried oregano
    Salt and pepper to taste
    1 cup cherry tomatoes
    1/2 cup chopped broccoli florets
    1/2 cup chopped asparagus
    Chopped fresh parsley (for garnish)
introduction: A simple and healthy sheet pan meal.
instructions:
Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
    Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
    Place the salmon fillets on the prepared baking sheet.
    Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
    Top with lemon slices, garlic, and oregano.
    Scatter cherry tomatoes, broccoli florets, and asparagus around the salmon.
    Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the salmon is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork and the vegetables are tender-crisp.
    Garnish with chopped fresh parsley before serving.

title: Simple Pasta with Marinara Sauce
ingredients:
1 pound dried pasta (e.g., penne, spaghetti)
    1 jar (24 oz) marinara sauce
    1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese (optional)
    Fresh basil leaves (optional)
introduction: A quick and easy weeknight meal.
instructions:
Cook the pasta according to package directions. Drain and set aside.
    Heat the marinara sauce in a saucepan over low heat until simmering.
    Toss the cooked pasta with the marinara sauce in a large serving bowl.
    Serve with grated Parmesan cheese and fresh basil leaves, if desired.

title: CHICKEN MASALA
ingredients:
1 kg chicken, cut into pieces
2 onions, finely chopped
3 tomatoes, pureed
4 cloves garlic, minced
1-inch ginger, grated
1 tablespoon vegetable oil
1 teaspoon cumin seeds
1 teaspoon coriander powder
1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder
1 teaspoon garam masala
1/2 teaspoon red chili powder (adjust to taste)
Salt to taste
Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
introduction: A delicious and aromatic Indian chicken curry that's easy to make at home.
instructions:
Heat oil in a large skillet or pan over medium heat.
Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add minced garlic and grated ginger. Sauté for another minute.
Add pureed tomatoes and cook until the oil separates.
Add coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well.
Add chicken pieces and coat them evenly with the masala.
Cover and cook for 20-25 minutes or until the chicken is tender, stirring occasionally.
Sprinkle garam masala and garnish with fresh coriander leaves.
Serve hot with steamed rice or naan

title: Spicy Black Bean Burgers
ingredients:
1 (15 oz) can black beans, rinsed and drained
    1 cup cooked brown rice
    1/2 cup chopped red onion
    1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro
    1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and finely chopped (optional)
    1/2 cup panko breadcrumbs
    1 egg, beaten
    1 tablespoon olive oil
    1 teaspoon chili powder
    1/2 teaspoon cumin
    1/4 teaspoon smoked paprika
    Salt and pepper to taste
    Hamburger buns
    Desired toppings (e.g., lettuce, tomato, avocado)
introduction: A flavorful and healthy vegetarian option.
instructions:
Mash the black beans in a large bowl.
    Add the brown rice, red onion, cilantro, jalapeno (if using), panko breadcrumbs, egg, olive oil, chili powder, cumin, smoked paprika, salt, and pepper.
    Mix well to combine.
    Form the mixture into patties.
    Heat a skillet over medium heat.
    Cook the burgers for 3-4 minutes per side, or until golden brown and cooked through.
    Serve on hamburger buns with your desired toppings.
